dataset.title: Interagency Ecological Program: Benthic invertebrate monitoring in the Sacramento-San Joaquin Bay-Delta, collected by the Environmental Monitoring Program, 1975-2024.
keyword: Interagency Ecological Program for the San Francisco Bay Delta Estuary

distribution.title: DWR Benthic raw count data 1975-2024
distribution.description: Benthic invertebrate raw data from upper San Francisco Estuary, monitored by the Environmental Monitoring Program, 1975-2024. This data file is too large to open in most spreadsheet programs, and is most easily handled with a coding language like R or Python. The count data are the original counts of organisms per 0.052 m2 Ponar dredge sample.

distribution.title: DWR Benthic CPUE data 1975-2024
distribution.description: Benthic invertebrate CPUE data from upper San Francisco Estuary, monitored by the Environmental Monitoring Program, 1975-2024. This data is intended for a more casual user, and is condensed from the raw dataset to be more tractable for spreadsheet programs. The data have been converted to CPUE (organisms/m2), replicate grabs have been averaged for each site visit, and all non-occurrence (zero) data for a site visit has been removed (but can be re-added by pivoting to wide format).

distribution.title: DWR benthic monitoring, active and historic site locations
distribution.description: DWR benthic monitoring site names, descriptions, coordinates, and status

distribution.title: DWR benthic monitoring, organism keylist
distribution.description: This data table lists all species that have been found, or were expected to be found, in the course of the Environmental Monitoring Program's mandated monitoring and special studies, including work outside the geographic bounds of this sampling program. Not all species listed here are found in the sampling data, and this data table is neither a definitive species list detected by our program, nor a metric of species richness. This data table is provided as a convenience to data users and sampling staff about what species might conceivably be found by benthic sampling in the upper San Francisco Estuary.

distribution.title: DWR Benthic monitoring, total annual site visits, 1975-2024
distribution.description: This data table documents how many site visits were conducted at each site in each year. It is provided as a convenience to data users who want to understand the structure of the data record, and compare levels of sampling effort at different times through the period of record. Since many sites were visited for only part of the period of EMP's sampling and there are many more historic than active sites, documenting the site visits in data table form was more precise than writing a narrative description.

distribution.title: DWR Benthic monitoring, total annual grab samples, 1975-2024
distribution.description: This data table documents how many total grab samples were collected at each site in each year. It is provided as a convenience to data users who want to understand the structure of the data record, and compare levels of sampling effort at different times through the period of record. Since many sites were visited for only part of the period of EMP's sampling and there are many more historic than active sites, documenting the number of grab samples in data table form was more precise than writing a narrative description.

distribution.title: DWR Benthic monitoring, missing data
distribution.description: This data table compiles the occasions on which benthic invertebrate data does not exist for a survey site in a given month. It was was compiled by reviewing the data record of site visits and grab totals. Data was designated as missing all grabs on a given date if the site had been sampled at dates both earlier and later than the date in question; many of the early "missing" dates may not be truly missing, since since the sampling design from 1975-mid 1979 was still being settled. Data was counted as missing some grab samples when the total grabs taken at a site in a given month was smaller than the number taken at other sites in in that month.

dataset.title: Harmful algal bloom and aquatic weeds data from the Sacramento-San Joaquin Delta, collected to evaluate the impact of the 2021 Temporary Urgency Change Order and Emergency Drought Barrier

distribution.title: Daily Air Temperature
distribution.description: A data set containing daily average air temperatures and degree days above 19 degrees Celsius for the region near the upper San Francisco Estuary (Delta) from 2015-2021. Values are based on averages of three continuous weather observation stations located near the Delta: San Joaquin River McCune station (SJR), Harvey O' Banks Pumping Plant (HBP), and San Joaquin River at Mossdale (MSD).

distribution.title: Discrete Nutrients and Chlorophyll
distribution.description: A data set containing concentrations of chlorophyll-a and three nutrient parameters (Dissolved Ammonia, Dissolved Nitrate + Nitrite, and Dissolved Ortho-phosphate) in water samples collected at various locations in the San Francisco Estuary (Delta) east of Chipps Island for 2014-2021.

distribution.title: Continuous Water Quality
distribution.description: A data set containing daily averages of various continuous water quality parameters measured in the water in-situ at the stations near Franks Tract located in the upper San Francisco Estuary (Delta). Water quality parameters include Dissolved Oxygen, pH, and Chlorophyll Fluorescence. Data was collected by DWR and USGS from 2015-2021.

distribution.title: Daily water tempertaure
distribution.description: A data set containing daily average water temperatures and degree days above 19 degrees Celsius for the upper San Francisco Estuary (Delta) from 2015-2021. Values are based on averages of six continuous water quality stations located in the Central and Southern Delta: False River near Oakley (FAL), Middle River near Holt (HLT), Holland Cut near Bethel Island (HOL), Middle River at Middle River (MDM), Old River at Quimbly (ORQ), and Old River at Franks Tract near Terminous (OSJ).

distribution.title: Cyanobacteria Satellite data
distribution.description: A data set containing counts of pixel values derived from HAB satellite data within 4 Cyano Index categories for four open water regions in the upper San Francisco Estuary (Delta): Franks Tract, Mildred Island, Clifton Court Forebay, and Liberty Island. Summary statistics cover the summer through fall (June-Oct) in 2019-2021. The Cyano Index categories (Low, Moderate, High, and Very High) were based on WHO recreational guidance level thresholds. The data set also includes counts of pixels that were below the detection limit for the imagery processing method and counts of pixels that were either invalid or missing.

distribution.title: HAB Incident Reports
distribution.description: A data set containing CyanoHAB incident reports in the upper San Francisco Estuary (Delta) in 2021. Most of this data is from the State Water Board's HAB Incident Report Map. This is combined with the maximum advisory levels for Microcystins that occurred at each station in 2021 from the cyanotoxin concentration data in the Cyanotoxins table. The advisory levels were developed by the California Cyanobacteria and Harmful Algal Bloom Network (CCHAB).

distribution.title: Cyanotoxins
distribution.description: A data set containing Cyanotoxin concentrations in whole-water grab samples collected at various locations in the upper San Francisco Estuary (Delta). The majority of the available cyanotoxin data was collected in 2021, so this data set only includes data from 2021 for all stations except for Big Break Regional Shoreline. Big Break has a longer monitoring history, so all data collected at this location from 2015–2021 are included in this data set.

distribution.title: Microcystis visual index and water quality
distribution.description: A data set containing Microcystis visual index, secchi depth, and water temperature data collected at various locations in the upper San Francisco Estuary (Delta) from 2007-2021.

distribution.title: Potentially Toxic Cyanobacteria cell counts
distribution.description: A data set containing phytoplankton community data of potentially toxic Cyanobacteria collected by DWR's Environmental Monitoring Program at various locations in the upper San Francisco Estuary (Delta) from 2014-2021.

distribution.title: Dayflow2014_2021
distribution.description: Daily flow parameters modeled by DWR's Dayflow program

distribution.title: Fluoroprobe mapping data
distribution.description: Fluorescence of various algal taxa measured by USGS and DWR during mapping surveys of the Delta. Data were collected with a Fluoroprobe.

distribution.title: Vegetation regional area estimates
distribution.description: UC Davis CSTARS analysis of hyperspectral imagery giving area covered by aquatic vegetation by region and year.

distribution.title: Franks Tract Fluridone_2006-2021
distribution.description: Fluridone (herbicide) treatments at Franks Tract

distribution.title: discrete_wq&outflow_data_summary
distribution.description: Suite of environmental variables hypothesized to affect or be affected by aquatic vegetation. Variables were generally collected in or near focal sites. Values are means of monthly measurements taken during the period each year expected to foster the most vegetation growth, March-October.

distribution.description: Field sampling of submersed aquatic vegetation in Franks Tract and Big Break by the UC-Davis CSTARS lab. Sampling was conducted using a weighted thatch rake head attached to a rope.

distribution.title: LES_combined_data
distribution.description: A combined table of all LES data. Each line represents a specific length of a particular taxa collected during one tow. Data was cleaned by formatting dates, removing extraneous columns, and combining all four tables into a single CSV file.

distribution.title: waterinfo
distribution.description: Raw CSV filed uploaded from the LES database. Each row represents environmental data collected during an individual tow.

distribution.title: towinfo
distribution.description: Raw CSV filed uploaded from the LES database. Each row represents environmental data collected during an individual tow.

distribution.title: catch
distribution.description: Raw CSV filed uploaded from the LES database. This table contains LES catch data. Each row contains the catch data for a particular species collected during a specific tow. Length data is not included - see Lengths.csv.

distribution.title: length
distribution.description: Raw CSV filed uploaded from the LES database. This is a table of LES length data. Each individual row represents a specific fish of a particular taxa collected during sampling and its length.

distribution.title: LES_data_formatting
distribution.description: An r script file containing code used to load the LES EDI data, provide basic cleaning and wrangling, and compile the tables into a single table for analytical use.

dataset.title: UC Davis Suisun Marsh Fish Study, CA,1980-2024

distribution.title: AgesBySizeMo
distribution.description: Age classification determined by size at time of capture; based on Manfree (2014a)

distribution.title: Catch
distribution.description: This table contains the organism (whether fish, shrimp, clam, detritus, etc) captured, the length (if a fish), the number caught at that size, and several other data types that are rarely, if ever, measured. OrganismCode - Organism Shorthand; code definitions in OrganismLookUp table StandardLength - fish length from tip of jaw to end of vertebral column (millimeters) Dead - if fish captured was live or dead (rarely used) Weight - mass (rarely used) (grams) Sex - male or female (rarely used) Count - catch (number of individuals or rank (for smaller invertebrates such as mysids) CatchComments - comments for specific organisms Volume - self-explanatory (milliliters) AgeClassforUnmeasuredFish - age class for unmeasured fish based upon Manfree (2014)

distribution.title: Depth
distribution.description: These are the depths for the otter trawl. Depth units are in meters.

distribution.title: GearDetailsLookUp
distribution.description: Contains records for measurements of our different sampling gear such as the otter trawl and larval sled.

distribution.title: GearSizeHL_Lookup
distribution.description: Contains records for measurements of hook and line sampling gear.

distribution.title: Habitat
distribution.description: Habitat characteristics of regions fished with hook and line sampling, including bank type, substrate, vegetation, anthropogenic structures and channel morphology. Abbreviations referenced in table HabitatCat.

distribution.title: HabitatCat
distribution.description: Habitat codes for habitat categories, including habitat descriptions and category with examples from North Delta and Suisun Marsh.

distribution.title: HookLineEffort
distribution.description: This table contains data on effort for hook and line sampling, including Bait Type; duration of effort (minutes); moon phase, number of rods in water (low, medium, and heavy weights), and skill level of participants (low, medium, and high).

distribution.title: LureBaitLookup
distribution.description: Table includes data on lures and baits used in hook and line sampling. Including bait codes, definitions, types and examples.

distribution.title: MethodsLookUp
distribution.description: Contains the sampling-method types, the corresponding codes, and whether that method type is currently active.

distribution.title: OrganismsLookUp
distribution.description: This table contains the codes and all taxonomic information for any organism we may catch.

distribution.title: Predator
distribution.description: This table contains all information accompanying the capture of a fish with hook and line. FishNum is number of individuals of a species captured at that size; TL_in is fish length fro tip of jaw to end of caudal fin tip (inches); Pumped is whether the fish was gut lavaged; Dissected is whether the fish was dissected for gut contents; TimeLanded was time fish was captured (hh:mm); LureBaitSize is size of lure/bait used in sample; LureBaitCode is type of lure used in sample; WaterSurface if water-surface condition when fish was captured; Weather is conditions when fish was captured; Tide is stage when fish was captured; Habitat is type where fish was hooked; Angler is initials of person who caught the fish; Killed? is whether fish was killed for gut contents.

distribution.title: Prey
distribution.description: This table contains the diet items of fish captured by hook-and-line and then gut-lavaged and/or dissected for stomach contents. FoodCode is prey-ID shorthand (code definitions in OrganismLookUp table); PreyNum is number of individuals for given prety type; StdLen is fish length from tip of jaw to end of vertebral column; for decapods, rostrum-telson length (mm); Comments specific to prey type in same row.

distribution.title: Sample
distribution.description: This table contains water-quality data, as well as the sample type, and date/time the sample was taken. MethodCode is sample-type shorthand (codes in MethodsLookUp table); StationCode is station shorthand (codes in StationsLookUp table); SampleDate (mm/dd/yyyy); SampleTime (hh:mm:ss AM/PM; QADone denotes wheter data have been checked again hard-copy data sheet; GearID is equivalent to MethodCode (unused); WaterTemperature is measured ~30 cm below water surface (degrees Celsius); Salinity is measured ~30 cm below water surface (parts per salinity unit or parts per thousand); DO is dissolved oxygen concentration (milligrams per liter); PctSaturation is DO percent saturation measured ~30 cm below water surface (percent); Secchi is water clarity (centimeters); SpecificCond is conductivity measured ~30 cm below water surface (microSiemens); TideCode is phase at time of sampling (flood, ebb, high, low); UserName is person who entered data; ElecCond is conductivity measured ~30 cm below water surface (microSiemens).

distribution.title: SeineEffort
distribution.description: This table contains the depths, seine types, lengths, and widths of the beach seines; all measurements in meters.

distribution.title: SledEffort
distribution.description: Contains the distances the larval sleds were towed as recorded by a General Oceanics mechanical flowmeter.

distribution.title: StationsLookUp
distribution.description: Contains codes and descriptions of sample stations.

distribution.title: TrawlEffort
distribution.description: Contains duration of midwater and otter trawls (in minutes) and distances covered (mainly for midwater trawls), as measured by the same flowmeter used for larval sleds.

distribution.title: UnitsLookUp
distribution.description: Provides information on units used for each datum.

distribution.title: VariableCodesLookUp
distribution.description: Contains additional descriptors of each sample, such as tide type and beach-seine type.

distribution.title: VariablesLookUp
distribution.description: Explains many of the codes we use.

dataset.title: Interagency Ecological Program: Zooplankton abundance in the Upper San Francisco Estuary from 1972-2021, an integration of 7 long-term monitoring programs
keyword: Interagency Ecological Program for the San Francisco Bay Delta Estuary
California Department of Fish and Wildlife

distribution.title: zooplankton_community.csv
distribution.description: The full dataset optimized for a community ecology analysis. This includes data from the rest of the tables, except the biomass table. So users should either use this file or construct their own dataset with the other tables. This dataset was optimized for community analysis by forcing each survey to have the same set of measured taxa. Any taxa not counted by all datasets was either summed to a higher level that would be comparable with all datasets, or removed if it had no close relatives in all datasets. However, taxonomic resolution is not consistent over time. This dataset was created using the zooper R package v2.5.0 with Zoopsynther(Data_type='Community'). To create a more customized dataset and read more information about how this dataset was created, visit https://github.com/InteragencyEcologicalProgram/zooper.

distribution.title: zooplankton.csv
distribution.description:
Catch per unit effort of micro, meso, and macro zooplankton from the
                              Upper San Francisco Estuary.

distribution.title: environment.csv
distribution.description:
Datetime, environmental, and water quality data from the zooplankton
                              surveys. Not all surveys collect data on all variables.
                              This table can be merged to the zooplankton table using the 'SampleID'
                              column as a key.

distribution.title: taxonomy.csv
distribution.description:
Taxonomic heirarchy for each species in this dataset, validated
                              primarily with the World Registry of Marine Species.

distribution.title: taxa_lists.csv
distribution.description: List of taxa identified by each survey and net size and dates of any changes.

distribution.title: undersampled.csv
distribution.description:
The taxa and life stages sampled in the indicated size class in
                              this table should be treated with caution, as they are likely
                              under sampled, i.e. the reported number is lower than their
                              actual abundance. More details can be found in the methods but
                              these zooplankton are likely either small enought to escape
                              through the mesh (for the taxa and life stages under sampled
                              in the meso sample) or large enough to swim away from the pump
                              (for the taxa and life stages under sampled in the micro sample).

distribution.title: stations.csv
distribution.description:
Latitude and longitude for each fixed sampling station.
                              These coordinates are also included in the environmental dataset,
                              although locations for FRP will differ slightly between the two
                              since FRP station locations are approximate and the coordinates
                              in the environmental dataset are the actual coordinates of each site visit.

distribution.description:
A comprehensive table of information on the 5 component studies

distribution.title: biomass_mesomicro.csv
distribution.description:
Average carbon mass of zooplankton species and life stages
                              obtained from the literature. Not all taxa and life stages
                              are represented due to gaps in the literature.

distribution.title: Benthic invertebrate traits
distribution.description: Literature-derived traits for the 63 most common benthic invertebrates found in ponar grabs of the long-term monitoring stations of the Environmental Monitoring Program (EMP) in the Upper San Francisco Estuary. distribution.title: FRP_orglookup
distribution.description: Table of taxonomic information for organisms caught in mesozooplankton, macroinvertebrate, and fish samples.

distribution.title: fish_FRP2023
distribution.description: Contains sample and catch data for fish samples. Typically, there is one observation (row) for each measured fish within a sample in addition to an observation (row) with a plus count (for non-measured individuals of a species). Total CPUE can be calculated by summing the individual catches, dividing by effort, and multiplying by 10,000 to get the number of fish per 10,000 m^3.

distribution.title: phyto_FRP2023
distribution.description: Contains sample and catch data for phytoplankton samples. There is typically one observation (row) for each measured phytoplankton cell or natural unit within a sample. CommonNames may be repeated in a sample, because two different taxa originally assigned by the contractor were assigned the same CommonName.

distribution.title: sitevisit_FRP2023
distribution.description: A site visit is a field data collection event. At each site visit, one or more samples may be collected. A site visit connects to samples in the macrozooplankton, zooplankton, or fish tables, via the VisitNo variable. Commonly, the site visit file will be merged with the macroinvert, zoops, or fish data files. This is a 1 to many merge, with VisitNo as the key variable. For example, in R, newdatafile<-merge(zoops_FRP2021, sitevisit_FRP2021, by=VisitNo). All samples are associated with a site visit, a site visit may have zero to many samples.

distribution.title: zoops_FRP2023
distribution.description: Mesozooplankton trawl data, including sample and catch data. CPUEs are reported for each taxon. To calculate the total CPUE for each sample, sum the CPUEs for individual taxa. Typically, there is one observation (row) for each taxonomic group within a sample, but occasionally, the subsampling was changed during processing and there are two observations (rows) for a single taxonomic group within the sample.

distribution.title: macroinvert_FRP2023
distribution.description: Contains sample and catch data for macroinvertebrate samples. Macroinvertebrate samples include all gear types with mesh size of 500 microns, including trawls, benthic samples, and samples taken in vegetation. To calculate the total CPUE for each sample, sum the CPUEs for individual taxa. Typically, there is one observation (row) for each taxonomic group within a sample, but occasionally, the subsampling was changed during processing and there are two observations (rows) for a single taxonomic group within the sample.

distribution.title: nutrients_FRP2023
distribution.description: Contains sample and lab data for nutrient samples. Analytes include Chlorophyll a, Dissolved Ammonia, Dissolved Nitrite + Nitrate, Dissolved Organic Carbon, Dissolved Organic Nitrogen, Dissolved Ortho-phosphate, Pheophytin a, Total Kjeldahl Nitrogen, Total Organic Carbon, Total Phosphorus, and Total Suspended Solids.

distribution.description: Contains detailed Standard Operating Procedures for field and lab data collection, including gear specifications.
